--- In neat@yahoogroups.com, "Mattias Fagerlund" <mattias@c...> 
wrote:
> > I am unfortunately 
> > involved in plugging NEAT into too many experiments at
> > the present time, but if you put your code in the
> > files section of this board, hopefully someone will take
> > interest.  
> 
> Could you perhaps outline what you're working on right now? 
Inquiring 
> minds want to know...
> 

Hi Mattias, how are you doing?  I am engaded in three main projects 
right now:

1) We are developing a video game based on neuroevolution.  It's 
pretty exciting since there's never been a game like this before. 
You can see a preliminary concept of the game at:

http://gamedev.ic2.org/tiki-index.php?page=LegionsOfInfluence 

This game will involve real-time (steady-state) evolution. In other 
words it will not be generational, but rather the worst network will 
be replaced with the best in real-time as the game is being played.
Thus for this game I am re-writing the main NEAT epoch loop for real-
time, which changes some of the equations. For example, the 
offspring assignments of generational evolution have to be replaced 
with probabilities.  Anyway, so this is a lot of programming and I 
am working with a development team on designing the game engine to 
be compatible with NEAT.

2) We have another project integrating NEAT with a sophisitcated 
automobile driving simulator.  The simulator source code is quite 
complicated and wasn't designed for machine learning, so it's a 
tricky integration project.

3) I have been working on Go with NEAT, although because of time 
constraints I may need to stop for now.  But I've been testing out 
novel ways of using neural networks in Go.  NEAT can evolve NN's
to defeat 5x5 gnugo, a public domain Go player, but the problem is 
it sort of memorizes how gnugo plays.  So I've also been coevolving 
Go players to be more general.  But the more general ones are not 
very strong.  Thus, I've been combining coevolution with gnugo 
hoping for a mix of generality and strength.  

So basically integrating NEAT with the game engine, the driving 
simulator, and gnugo, are all pretty extensive integration projects 
leaving me unfortunately little time to try other things.

ken
